snippet: More than 9,000 children 12 or younger died in car crashes during the decade covered by a federal report.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports motor vehicle-related deaths of children 12 and younger fell by 43 percent from 2002 to 2011; auto accidents still remain a leading cause of deaths of children in United States, and many could have been prevented with use of properly-fitted safety restraints.
lead_paragraph: More than 9,000 children 12 or younger died in car crashes during the decade covered by a federal report.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
